019package org.tquadrat.foundation.lang;
020
021import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
022import static java.util.Arrays.deepToString;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NULL_STRING;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.SharedFormatter.format;
026
027import java.lang.reflect.Array;
028import java.util.Arrays;
029import java.util.Collection;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.Enumeration;
032import java.util.List;
033import java.util.Map;
034import java.util.Optional;
035import java.util.function.Function;
036import java.util.function.Predicate;
037import java.util.function.Supplier;
038import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;
039
040import org.apiguardian.api.API;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
043import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.EmptyArgumentException;
044import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.NullArgumentException;
045import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
046import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ValidationException;

048/**
049 *  This class consists of several utility methods working on
050 *  {@link Object}
051 *  instances, similar to those on
052 *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
053 *  or
054 *  {@link java.util.Collections}. <br>
055 *  <br>The class was originally inspired by the class of the same name that
056 *  was finally introduced with the Java&nbsp;7 release; some of its methods
057 *  will delegate to
058 *  {@link java.util.Objects}.
059 *  others will extend the functionality of the methods with the same
060 *  name from {@code java.util.Objects}.
061 *
062 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
063 *  @version $Id: Objects.java 997 2022-01-26 14:55:05Z tquadrat $
064 *  @since 0.1.0
065 *
066 *  @UMLGraph.link
067 */
068@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "UseOfObsoleteDateTimeApi", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
069@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Objects.java 997 2022-01-26 14:55:05Z tquadrat $" )
070@UtilityClass
071public final class Objects
072{
073        /*--------------*\
074    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
075        \*--------------*/
076    /**
077     *  No instance allowed for this class.
078     */
079    private Objects() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Objects.class ); }
080
081        /*---------*\
082    ====** Methods **==========================================================
083        \*---------*/
084    /**
085     *  Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive) to
086     *  {@code fromIndex + size} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range from
087     *  {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).<br>
088     *  <br>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the
089     *  following inequalities is true:
090     *  <ul>
091     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
092     *    <li>{@code size < 0}</li>
093     *    <li>{@code fromIndex + size > length}, taking into account integer
094     *    overflow</li>
095     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
096     *    inequalities</li>
097     *  </ul>
098     *  Calls
099     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromIndexSize(int, int, int)}
100     *  internally.
101     *
102     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-interval.
103     *  @param  size    The size of the sub-range.
104     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
105     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
106     *      range.
107     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
108     */
109    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
110    public static final int checkFromIndexSize( final int fromIndex, final int size, final int length ) { return java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize( fromIndex, size, length ); }
111
112    /**
113     *  Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive) to
114     *  {@code toIndex} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range from
115     *  {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).<br>
116     *  <br>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the
117     *  following inequalities is true:
118     *  <ul>
119     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
120     *    <li>{@code fromIndex > toIndex}</li>
121     *    <li>{@code toIndex > length}</li>
122     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
123     *    inequalities</li>
124     *  </ul>
125     *  Calls
126     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromToIndex(int, int, int)}
127     *  internally.
128     *
129     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-range.
130     *  @param  toIndex The upper-bound (exclusive) of the sub-range.
131     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) the range.
132     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
133     *      range.
134     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
135     */
136    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
137    public static final int checkFromToIndex( final int fromIndex, final int toIndex, final int length ) { return java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex( fromIndex, toIndex, length ); }
138
139    /**
140     *  Checks if the {@code index} is within the bounds of the range from
141     *  {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).<br>
142     *  <br>The {@code index} is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the
143     *  following inequalities is true:
144     *  <ul>
145     *    <li>{@code index < 0}</li>
146     *    <li>{@code index >= length}</li>
147     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
148     *    inequalities</li>
149     *  </ul>
150     *  Calls
151     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkIndex(int, int)}
152     *  internally.
153     *
154     *  @param  index   The index.
155     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
156     *  @return The {@code index} if it is within bounds of the range.
157     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The {@code index} is out-of-bounds.
158     */
159    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
160    public static final int checkIndex( final int index, final int length ) { return java.util.Objects.checkIndex( index, length ); }
161
162    /**
163     *  <p>{@summary Throws the exception provided by the given supplier if the
164     *  condition resolves to {@code false}.}</p>
165     *  <p>Basically, this method is a replacement for the code sequence
166     *  below:</p>
167     *  <pre><code>  â¦
168     *  if( !&lt;<i>condition</i>&gt; )
169     *  {
170     *      throw new &lt;<i>WhatEver</i>&gt;Exception( &lt;<i>WhatEverMessage</i>&gt; );
171     *  }
172     *  â¦</code></pre>
173     *  <p>that may be easier to read that the {@code if} statement.</p>
174     *
175     *  @param  <E> The type of the exception that is thrown in case the
176     *      condition is not met.
177     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
178     *  @param  exception   The exception to throw.
179     *  @throws E   The condition was not met.
180     */
181    @SuppressWarnings( "CheckedExceptionClass" )
182    public static final <E extends Exception> void checkState( final boolean condition, final Supplier<E> exception ) throws E
183    {
184        if( !condition ) throw requireNonNullArgument( exception, "exception" ).get();
185    }   //  checkState()
186    /**
187     *  Returns 0 if the arguments are identical and {@code c.compare(a, b)}
188     *  otherwise.<br>
189     *  <br>Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, 0 is
190     *  returned.<br>
191     *  <br>Calls
192     *  {@link java.util.Objects#compare(Object, Object, Comparator)}
193     *  internally, but different from that method, this implementation will
194     *  throw a
195     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
196     *  in case the {@code comparator} is {@code null}.
197     *
198     *  @param  <T> The type of the objects being compared.
199     *  @param  a   An object.
200     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a}.
201     *  @param  comparator  The
202     *      {@link Comparator}
203     *      to compare the first two arguments.
204     *  @return 0 if the arguments are identical and +1, 0, or -1, based on the
205     *      return value of {@code c.compare(a, b)} otherwise.
206     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code comparator} is {@code null}.
207     *
208     *  @see Comparable
209     *  @see Comparator
210     */
211    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
212    public static final <T> int compare( final T a, final T b, final Comparator<? super T> comparator ) throws NullArgumentException
213    {
214        final var retValue = a == b ? 0 : signum( java.util.Objects.compare( a, b, requireNonNullArgument( comparator, "comparator" ) ) );
215
216        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
217        return retValue;
218    }   //  compare()
219
220    /**
221     *  Returns {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to each other
222     *  and {@code false} otherwise.<br>
223     *  <br>Two {@code null} values are deeply equal. If both arguments are
224     *  arrays, the algorithm in
225     *  {@link Arrays#deepEquals(Object[], Object[]) Arrays.deepEquals()}
226     *  is used to determine equality. Otherwise, equality is determined by
227     *  using the
228     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
229     *  method of the first argument.<br>
230     *  <br>Calls
231     *  {@link java.util.Objects#deepEquals(Object, Object)}
232     *  internally.
233     *
234     *  @param  a   An object.
235     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a} for deep equality.
236     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to each other
237     *      and {@code false} otherwise.
238     *
239     *  @see Arrays#deepEquals(Object[], Object[])
240     *  @see Objects#equals(Object, Object)
241     */
242    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
243    public static final boolean deepEquals( final Object a, final Object b ) { return java.util.Objects.deepEquals( a, b ); }
244
245    /**
246     *  Returns {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each other and
247     *  {@code false} otherwise.<br>
248     *  <br> Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, {@code true} is
249     *  returned and if exactly one argument is {@code null}, {@code false} is
250     *  returned.  Otherwise, equality is determined by using the
251     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
252     *  method of the first argument.<br>
253     *  <br>Calls
254     *  {@link java.util.Objects#equals(Object, Object)}
255     *  internally.
256     *
257     *  @param  a   An object.
258     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a} for equality.
259     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each other and
260     *      {@code false} otherwise.
261     *
262     *  @see Object#equals(Object)
263     */
264    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
265    public static final boolean equals( final Object a, final Object b ) { return java.util.Objects.equals( a, b ); }
266
267    /**
268     *  Generates a hash code for a sequence of input values. The hash code is
269     *  generated as if all the input values were placed into an array, and
270     *  that array were hashed by calling
271     *  {@link Arrays#hashCode(Object[])}.<br>
272     *  <br>Calls
273     *  {@link java.util.Arrays#hashCode(Object[])}
274     *  internally.
275     *
276     *  @param  values  The values to be hashed.
277     *  @return A hash value of the sequence of input values.
278     *
279     *  @see List#hashCode
280     */
281    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
282    public static final int hash( final Object... values ) { return Arrays.hashCode( values ); }
283
284    /**
285     *  Returns the hash code of a non-{@code null} argument and 0 for
286     *  a {@code null} argument.<br>
287     *  <br>Calls
288     *  {@link java.util.Objects#hashCode(Object)}
289     *  internally.
290     *
291     *  @param o   An object.
292     *  @return The hash code of an argument that is not {@code null}, and 0
293     *      for a {@code null} argument,
294     *
295     *  @see Object#hashCode
296     */
297    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
298    public static final int hashCode( final Object o ) { return java.util.Objects.hashCode( o ); }
299
300    /**
301     *  Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is {@code null},
302     *  otherwise returns {@code false}.<br>
303     *  <br>This method exists to be used as a
304     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
305     *  {@code filter(Objects::isNull)}.<br>
306     *  <br>Calls
307     *  {@link java.util.Objects#isNull(Object)}
308     *  internally.
309     *
310     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}.
311     *  @return {@code true} if the provided reference is {@code null},
312     *      otherwise {@code false}
313     *
314     *  @see java.util.function.Predicate
315     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#IS_NULL
316     */
317    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
318    public static final boolean isNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.isNull( obj ); }
319
320    /**
321     *  <p>{@summary Maps (converts) the given object instance by applying the provided mapper if the
322     *  instance is not {@code null}.}</p>
323     *  <p>The mapper function will not be called at all if the given instance is
324     *  {@code null}.</p>
325     *
326     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
327     *  @param  <R> The type of the result.
328     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
329     *  @param  mapper  The mapping function.
330     *  @return The result of the mapping, or {@code null} if the given object
331     *      instance was already {@code null}.
332     */
333    public static final <T,R> R mapNonNull( final T o, final Function<T,R> mapper )
334    {
335        @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantExplicitVariableType" )
336        final R retValue = nonNull( o ) ? requireNonNullArgument( mapper, "mapper" ).apply( o ) : null;
337
338        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
339        return retValue;
340    }   //  mapNonNull()
341
342    /**
343     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is not
344     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
345     *  <p>This method exists to be used as a
346     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
347     *  {@code filter(Objects::nonNull)}</p>
348     *  <p>Calls
349     *  {@link java.util.Objects#nonNull(Object)}
350     *  internally.</p>
351     *
352     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}
353     *  @return {@code false} if the provided reference is {@code null},
354     *      otherwise {@code true}
355     *
356     *  @see java.util.function.Predicate
357     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NON_NULL
358     */
359    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
360    public static final boolean nonNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.nonNull( obj ); }
361
362    /**
363     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
364     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
365     *  is thrown.
366     *
367     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
368     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
369     *  @param  validation  The validation
370     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
371     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    {@code a} failed the validation.
372     *
373     *  @since 0.1.0
374     */
375    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
376    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
377    public static final <T> T require( final T a, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws IllegalArgumentException
378    {
379        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
380        {
381            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
382        }
383
384        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
385        return a;
386    }   //  require()
387
388    /**
389     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
390     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
391     *  with the specified message is thrown.
392     *
393     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
394     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
395     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
396     *  @param  validation  The validation
397     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
398     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    {@code a} failed the validation.
399     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
400     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
401     *
402     *  @since 0.1.0
403     */
404    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
405    public static final <T> T require( final T a, final String message, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws IllegalArgumentException, NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
406    {
407        requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" );
408
409        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
410        {
411            throw new IllegalArgumentException( message );
412        }
413
414        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
415        return a;
416    }   //  require()
417
418    /**
419     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, a
420     *  customized
421     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
422     *  is thrown.<br>
423     *  <br>Unlike the method
424     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
425     *  this method allows creation of the message to be deferred until after
426     *  the validation was performed. While this may confer a performance
427     *  advantage in the success case, when deciding to call this method care
428     *  should be taken that the costs of creating the message supplier are
429     *  less than the cost of just creating the String message directly.
430     *
431     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
432     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
433     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
434     *      in the event that an {@code IllegalArgumentException} is thrown. If
435     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
436     *      provided.
437     *  @param  validation  The validation
438     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
439     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    {@code a} failed the validation.
440     *
441     *  @since 0.1.0
442     */
443    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
444    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
445    public static final <T> T require( final T a, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws IllegalArgumentException
446    {
447        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
448        {
449            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
450                ? new IllegalArgumentException( messageSupplier.get() )
451                : new IllegalArgumentException();
452            throw exception;
453        }
454
455        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
456        return a;
457    }   //  require()
458
459    /**
460     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, a
461     *  customized
462     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
463     *  is thrown.<br>
464     *  <br>Unlike the method
465     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
466     *  this method allows creation of the message to be deferred until after
467     *  the validation was performed. While this may confer a performance
468     *  advantage in the success case, when deciding to call this method care
469     *  should be taken that the costs of creating the message supplier are
470     *  less than the cost of just creating the String message directly.
471     *
472     *  @note This implementation is different from
473     *      {@link #requireNonNull(Object, Supplier)}
474     *      as it takes an instance of
475     *      {@link Function}
476     *      for the {@code messageSupplier}. That function is called with
477     *      {@code a} as the argument; this allows to add the invalid value to
478     *      the exception message. The provided function must accept
479     *      {@code null} as a valid argument.
480     *
481     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
482     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
483     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
484     *      in the event that an {@code IllegalArgumentException} is thrown. If
485     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
486     *      provided.
487     *  @param  validation  The validation
488     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
489     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    {@code a} failed the validation.
490     *
491     *  @since 0.1.0
492     */
493    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
494    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
495    public static final <T> T require( final T a, final Function<? super T,String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws IllegalArgumentException
496    {
497        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
498        {
499            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
500                ? new IllegalArgumentException( messageSupplier.apply( a ) )
501                : new IllegalArgumentException();
502            throw exception;
503        }
504
505        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
506        return a;
507    }   //  require()
508
509    /**
510     *  Checks if the given value {@code a} is {@code null} and throws a
511     *  {@link NullPointerException}
512     *  if it is {@code null}.<br>
513     *  <br>Calls
514     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object)}
515     *  internally.
516     *
517     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
518     *  @param  a   The value to check.
519     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
520     *  @throws NullPointerException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
521     */
522    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
523    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T a ) { return java.util.Objects.requireNonNull( a ); }
524
525    /**
526     *  Checks if the given value {@code a} is {@code null} and throws a
527     *  {@link NullPointerException}
528     *  with the specified message if it is {@code null}.<br>
529     *  <br>Calls
530     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object, String)}
531     *  internally, but requires that the given {@code message} is not
532     *  {@code null} or empty.
533     *
534     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
535     *  @param  a   The value to check.
536     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
537     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
538     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code a} is {@code null}.
539     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
540     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
541     */
542    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
543    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T a, final String message ) throws NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
544    {
545        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNull( a, requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" ) );
546    }   //  requireNonNull()
547
548    /**
549     *  Checks that the specified object reference is not {@code null} and
550     *  throws a customized
551     *  {@link NullPointerException}
552     *  if it is.<br>
553     *  <br>Unlike the method
554     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object, String)},
555     *  this method allows creation of the message to be deferred until after
556     *  the null check is made. While this may confer a performance advantage
557     *  in the non-null case, when deciding to call this method care should be
558     *  taken that the costs of creating the message supplier are less than the
559     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.<br>
560     *  <br>Calls
561     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object, Supplier)}
562     *  internally.
563     *
564     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
565     *  @param  a   The value to check.
566     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
567     *      in the event that a {@code NullPointerException} is thrown. If
568     *      {@code null}, no detail message is provided.
569     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
570     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code A} is {@code null}
571     */
572    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
573    public static final <T> T requireNonNull(final T a, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier) { return java.util.Objects.requireNonNull( a, messageSupplier ); }
574
575    /**
576     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} and throws a
577     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
578     *  if it is {@code null}.
579     *
580     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
581     *  @param  a   The argument to check.
582     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
583     *      message.
584     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}.
585     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
586     */
587    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
588    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T a, final String name )
589    {
590        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
591        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
592        if( isNull( a ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
593
594        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
595        return a;
596    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
597
598    /**
599     *  Checks if not both of the given arguments {@code a} and
600     *  {@code other} are {@code null} and throws a
601     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
602     *  if both are {@code null}. Otherwise, it returns {@code a}.
603     *
604     *  @param  <T> The type of the first argument to check.
605     *  @param  arg The first argument to check; it will be returned in case of
606     *      success, even if {@code null}.
607     *  @param  otherArg    The other argument to check.
608     *  @param  name    The name of the first argument; this is used for the
609     *      error message.
610     *  @param  otherName   The name of the other argument; this is used for
611     *      the error message.
612     *  @return The first argument, even that might be {@code null}.
613     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Both arguments are {@code null}.
614     */
615    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.7" )
616    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T arg, final Object otherArg, final String name, final String otherName )
617    {
618        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
619        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
620        if( isNull( otherName ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "otherName" );
621        if( otherName.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "otherName" );
622        if( isNull( arg ) && isNull( otherArg ) )
623        {
624            throw new NullArgumentException( name, otherName );
625        }
626
627        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
628        return arg;
629    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
630
631    /**
632     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} or empty and
633     *  throws a
634     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
635     *  if it is {@code null}, or a
636     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
637     *  if it is empty.<br>
638     *  <br>Strings, arrays,
639     *  {@link java.util.Collection}s, and
640     *  {@link java.util.Map}s
641     *  will be checked on being empty; this includes instances of
642     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuilder},
643     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuffer},
644     *  and
645     *  {@link java.lang.CharSequence}.<br>
646     *  <br>For an instance of
647     *  {@link java.util.Optional},
648     *  the presence of a value is checked in order to determine whether it is
649     *  empty or not.<br>
650     *  <br>Because the interface
651     *  {@link java.util.Enumeration}
652     *  does not provide an API for the check on emptiness
653     *  ({@link java.util.Enumeration#hasMoreElements() hasMoreElements()}
654     *  will return {@code false} after all elements have been taken from
655     *  the {@code Enumeration} instance), the result for arguments of this
656     *  type has to be taken with caution.<br>
657     *  <br>For instances of
658     *  {@link java.util.stream.Stream},
659     *  this method will only check for {@code null} (like
660     *  {@link #requireNonNullArgument(Object,String)}.
661     *  This is because any operation on the stream would render it unusable
662     *  for later processing.<br>
663     *  <br>In case the argument is of type
664     *  {@link Optional},
665     *  this method behaves different from
666     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String)};
667     *  this one will return the {@code Optional} instance, while the other
668     *  method will return its contents.
669     *
670     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
671     *  @param  a   The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
672     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
673     *      message.
674     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}.
675     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a} is {@code null}.
676     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code a} is empty.
677     */
678    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
679    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( final T a, final String name )
680    {
681        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
682        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
683
684        //---* Check for null *------------------------------------------------
685        if( isNull( a ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
686
687        //---* Check the type *------------------------------------------------
688        //noinspection IfStatementWithTooManyBranches
689        if( a instanceof CharSequence charSequence )
690        {
691            if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
692        }
693        else if( a.getClass().isArray() )
694        {
695            if( Array.getLength( a ) == 0 ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
696        }
697        else if( a instanceof Collection<?> collection )
698        {
699            if( collection.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
700        }
701        else if( a instanceof Map<?,?> )
702        {
703            if( ((Map<?,?>) a).isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
704        }
705        else if( a instanceof Enumeration<?> )
706        {
707            /*
708             * The funny thing with an Enumeration is that it could have been
709             * not empty in the beginning, but it may be empty (= having no
710             * more elements) now.
711             * The good thing is that Enumeration.hasMoreElements() will not
712             * change the state of the Enumeration - at least it should not do
713             * so.
714             */
715            if( !((Enumeration<?>) a).hasMoreElements() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
716        }
717        else if( a instanceof Optional<?> optional)
718        {
719            /*
720             * This is different from the behaviour of
721             * requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String) as the Optional will be
722             * returned here.
723             */
724            if( optional.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
725        }
726        else
727        {
728            /*
729             * Other data types are not further processed; in particular,
730             * instances of Stream cannot be checked on being empty. This is
731             * because any operation on the Stream itself will change its state
732             * and may make the Stream unusable.
733             */
734        }
735
736        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
737        return a;
738    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
739
740    /**
741     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} of type
742     *  {@link Optional}
743     *  is {@code null} or empty and
744     *  throws a
745     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
746     *  if it is {@code null}, or a
747     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
748     *  if it is empty.<br>
749     *  <br>Otherwise it returns the value of the {@code Optional}.<br>
750     *  <br>This is different from the behaviour of
751     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Object,String)}
752     *  with an instance of {@code Optional} as the argument to test.
753     *
754     *  @param  <T> The type of the given {@code Optional} to check.
755     *  @param  optional    The argument to check; can be {@code null}.
756     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
757     *      message.
758     *  @return The value of the argument if {@code optional} is not
759     *      {@code null}.
760     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code optional} is {@code null}.
761     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code optional} is empty.
762     */
763    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
764    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" ) final Optional<T> optional, final String name )
765    {
766        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
767        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
768
769        //---* Check for null *------------------------------------------------
770        if( isNull( optional ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
771        final var retValue = optional.orElseThrow( () -> new EmptyArgumentException( name ) );
772
773        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
774        return retValue;
775    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
776
777    /**
778     *  Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise it
779     *  returns the non-{@code null} second argument.<br>
780     *  <br>This implementation behaves different from that in
781     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object,Object)}
782     *  as it will always check that the default is not {@code null}.
783     *
784     *  @param <T>  The type of the references.
785     *  @param  obj An object reference.
786     *  @param  defaultObj  Another object reference to be returned if the
787     *      first argument is {@code null}.
788     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
789     *      second argument if it is not {@code null}.
790     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code defaultObj} is {@code null}.
791     *
792     *  @see java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object, Object)
793     */
794    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
795    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElse( final T obj, final T defaultObj ) throws NullArgumentException
796    {
797        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse( obj, requireNonNullArgument( defaultObj, "defaultObj" ) );
798    }   //  requireNonNullElse()
799
800    /**
801     *  Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise it
802     *  returns the non-{@code null} value returned by
803     *  {@link Supplier#get() supplier.get()}.<br>
804     *  <br>This implementation behaves different from that in
805     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier)}
806     *  as it will always check that the supplier is not {@code null}.
807     *
808     *  @param <T>  The type of the reference.
809     *  @param  obj An object reference.
810     *  @param  supplier    The supplier of a non-{@code null} object of type
811     *      {code T} to return if the first argument is {@code null}.
812     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
813     *      value returned by a call to {@code supplier.get()} if it is not
814     *      {@code null}.
815     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code supplier} is {@code null}.
816     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code obj} is {@code null} and the
817     *      return value of {@code supplier.get()} value is {@code null}, too.
818     */
819    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionDeclared" )
820    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
821    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElseGet( final T obj, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier ) throws NullArgumentException, NullPointerException
822    {
823        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet( obj, requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ) );
824    }   //  requireNonNullElseGet()
825
826    /**
827     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
828     *  {@link ValidationException}
829     *  with a default message is thrown.
830     *
831     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
832     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
833     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
834     *      message.
835     *  @param  validation  The validation
836     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
837     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
838     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} or {@code validation} is
839     *      {@code null}.
840     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
841     *
842     *  @since 0.1.0
843     */
844    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
845    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T a, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
846    {
847        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
848
849        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
850        {
851            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
852        }
853
854        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
855        return a;
856    }   //  requireValidArgument()
857
858    /**
859     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
860     *  {@link ValidationException}
861     *  is thrown. The message for the exception will be provided by the given
862     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an argument.
863     *
864     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
865     *  @param  a   The value to check; can be {@code null}.
866     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
867     *      message.
868     *  @param  validation  The validation
869     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
870     *      exception.
871     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
872     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
873     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name}, {@code validation} or
874     *      {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
875     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
876     *
877     *  @since 0.1.0
878     */
879    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
880    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T a, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
881    {
882        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
883        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
884
885        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( a ) )
886        {
887            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
888        }
889
890        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
891        return a;
892    }   //  requireValidArgument()
893
894    /**
895     *  Applies the given validation on the given value (that may not be
896     *  {@code null}), and if that fails, an
897     *  {@link ValidationException}
898     *  with a default message is thrown.
899     *
900     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
901     *  @param  a   The value to check.
902     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
903     *      message.
904     *  @param  validation  The validation
905     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
906     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
907     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a}, {@code name} or
908     *      {@code validation} is {@code null}.
909     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
910     *
911     *  @since 0.1.0
912     */
913    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
914    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T a, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
915    {
916        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
917
918        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( a, "name" ) ) )
919        {
920            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
921        }
922
923        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
924        return a;
925    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
926
927    /**
928     *  Applies the given validation on the given value (that may not be
929     *  {@code null}), and if that fails, an
930     *  {@link ValidationException}
931     *  is thrown. The message for the exception will be provided by the given
932     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an argument.
933     *
934     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
935     *  @param  a   The value to check.
936     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
937     *      message.
938     *  @param  validation  The validation
939     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
940     *      exception.
941     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
942     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
943     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code a}, {@code name},
944     *      {@code validation} or {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
945     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
946     *
947     *  @since 0.1.0
948     */
949    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
950    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T a, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
951    {
952        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
953        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
954
955        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( a, "name" ) ) )
956        {
957            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
958        }
959
960        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
961        return a;
962    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
963
964    /**
965     *  Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
966     *  {@link String},
967     *  usually by calling its
968     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
969     *  method. If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
970     *  &quot;{@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING null}&quot;
971     *  will be returned instead. Arrays will be converted to a string through
972     *  calling the respective {@code toString()} method from
973     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
974     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
975     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object, String)}).
976     *  Values of type
977     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
978     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
979     *  will be translated based on the default locale - whatever that is.
980     *
981     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
982     *  @return The object's string representation.
983     *
984     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
985     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
986     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
987     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
988     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
989     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
990     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
991     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
992     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
993     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
994     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
995     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING
996     */
997    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
998    public static final String toString( final Object object )
999    {
1000        return toString( object, NULL_STRING );
1001    }   //  toString()
1002
1003    /**
1004     *  Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1005     *  {@link String},
1006     *  usually by calling its
1007     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1008     *  method. If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1009     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned instead.
1010     *  Arrays will be converted to a string through calling the respective
1011     *  {@code toString()} method from
1012     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1013     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1014     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object, String)}).
1015     *  Values of type
1016     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1017     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1018     *  will be translated based on the default locale - whatever that is.
1019     *
1020     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1021     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1022     *      is {@code null}.
1023     *  @return The object's string representation.
1024     *
1025     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1026     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1027     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1028     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1029     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1030     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1031     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1032     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1033     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1034     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1035     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1036     */
1037    @SuppressWarnings( {"IfStatementWithTooManyBranches", "ChainOfInstanceofChecks"} )
1038    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1039    public static final String toString( final Object object, final String nullDefault )
1040    {
1041        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1042        if( nonNull( object ) )
1043        {
1044            final var objectClass = object.getClass();
1045            if( objectClass.isArray() )
1046            {
1047                if( objectClass == byte [].class )
1048                {
1049                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (byte []) object );
1050                }
1051                else if( objectClass == short [].class )
1052                {
1053                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (short []) object );
1054                }
1055                else if( objectClass == int [].class )
1056                {
1057                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (int []) object );
1058                }
1059                else if( objectClass == long [].class )
1060                {
1061                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (long []) object );
1062                }
1063                else if( objectClass == char [].class )
1064                {
1065                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (char []) object );
1066                }
1067                else if( objectClass == float [].class )
1068                {
1069                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (float []) object );
1070                }
1071                else if( objectClass == double [].class )
1072                {
1073                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (double []) object );
1074                }
1075                else if( objectClass == boolean [].class )
1076                {
1077                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (boolean []) object );
1078                }
1079                else
1080                {
1081                    retValue = deepToString( (Object []) object );
1082                }
1083            }
1084            else
1085            {
1086                retValue = object.toString();
1087            }
1088        }
1089
1090        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1091        return retValue;
1092    }   //  toString()
1093
1094    /**
1095     *  Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1096     *  {@link String}
1097     *  using the given instance of
1098     *  {@link Stringer}.
1099     *  If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1100     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned instead.
1101     *
1102     *  @param  <T> The type of the object.
1103     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1104     *  @param  stringer    The method that is used to convert the given object
1105     *      to a String.
1106     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1107     *      is {@code null}.
1108     *  @return The object's string representation.
1109     *
1110     *  @see Stringer
1111     */
1112    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1113    public static final <T> String toString( final T object, final Stringer<? super T> stringer, final String nullDefault )
1114    {
1115        requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1116
1117        final var retValue = nonNull( object ) ? requireNonNullArgument( stringer, "stringer" ).toString( object ) : nullDefault;
1118
1119        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1120        return retValue;
1121    }   //  toString()
1122}
1123//  class Objects
1124
1125/*
1126 *  End of File
1127 */
